thread.title: Wallets get a little fatter for Tampa Bay’s richest families
thread.title_full: Wallets get a little fatter for Tampa Bay’s richest families

title: Wallets get a little fatter for Tampa Bay’s richest families
text:
See All Bizspace Properties The Glazer and Lykes families’ rankings on the 2015 list were lower than last year, although their wealth increased. The Glazer family is No. 63 on this year’s list, with $4.7 billion in combined net worth. Their combined net worth last year was $4.4 billion, when the family was No. 58 on the list. Forbes lists Palm Beach as the “company headquarters” for the family, which owns the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and controls 83 percent of the voting stock of Manchester United (NYSE: MANU). The family’s First Allied Corp. owns more than 6.7 million square feet of commercial real estate, primarily shopping centers. The Lykes family, with $1.2 billion in combined net worth, is No. 193 on the 2015 list, down from No. 170 on last year’s list, when the family’s net worth was $1.1 billion. The family made its fortune in citrus production and cattle ranching and today owns more 600,000 acres in Florida and Texas. Four other Florida families made the Forbes list this year: The France family in Daytona Beach, No. 53 with $5.7 billion in net worth from Nascar racing The Moran family in Deerfield Beach, No. 54 with $5.5 billion in net worth from Toyota distribution The Collier family in Naples, No. 119 with $2.3 billion in net worth from real estate The Morse family in The Villages, No. 163 with $1.5 billion in net worth from real estate development The Walton family, which owns more than half of the stock of Wal-Mart Stores Inc. (NYSE: WMT), the world’s largest retailer, is No. 1 on the Forbes list, with $149 billion in combined net worth.
